text: hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm with creamy bay scallops spaghetti
that's right after all those rich
decadent time-consuming and complex
holiday recipes we're in the mood for
something fast easy and light and is my
old friend meatloaf once said two out of
three ain't bad so while this is very
fast and easy it's not particularly
light but it is incredibly delicious and
theoretically you could make this creamy
sherry scallop sauce while the pasta is
cooking so let's test that theory so I'm
going to boil some thick spaghetti in
salted water which is going to take
about ten minutes so our sketti is
cooking we're going to go ahead and put
a large skillet on very high heat and
we're gonna get that super hot and when
you see that first tiny wisp of smoke
we're gonna go ahead and dump in our bay
scallops all right move them around with
the spatula until they're in a single
layer and we're just going to let those
sear on high for about 60 seconds and
then after a minute you're going to take
your spatula and give em a quick toss
and you'll see we're getting a little
bit of color on some of them alright
there's no way we're going to brown all
these or try to turn them that's not
this kind of a recipe so I just want you
give them a quick toss here and at that
point we're going to throw in our butter
and the reason we're putting that in now
and not at the beginning that pan was so
hot the butter would have got brown and
nutty which is good for some recipes but
not this one so we're going to put that
in at this point give it a stir and as
soon as that butter melts we're going to
go ahead and add our chopped garlic
actually it's more like minced and we'll
give that a quick stir maybe 30 seconds
and that hots kelby butter next up a
nice big pinch of freshly grated lemon
zest and also a nice pinch of red pepper
flakes just warm it up a touch will give
that a quick stir and then we're going
to deglaze with some sherry if you don't
like share your campfire sherry well
quite frankly you didn't look very hard
but you can certainly use a splash of
white wine for this and by the way
there's some very sweet cherries they
serve as dessert wines you don't want
that one if you're not sure ask the guy
at the liquor store or even better one
of your Spanish friends they know but
anyway we're going to cook that sherry
for about a minute
we're just taking that raw edge off
boiling off that alcohol and then after
we've cooked that sherry for about a
minute we're going to add some cold
heavy cream and of course that's going
to come up to temperature and start to
simmer at that point we're going to turn
everything into medium-low and we'll
simply wait for our spaghetti to be
cooked which should only be a couple
more minutes and while we'll rating
we're going to do a little more
seasoning I'm going to throw in some
freshly ground black pepper and a big
pinch of salt
as well as a little fresh lemon juice of
course that's to taste people stop
adding all the lemon juice in a recipe
and telling me there's too much lemon I
mean come on Who am I to tell you how
much lemon to put in I'm just some
random stranger you met on YouTube so
use how much you like and then like I
said we're just going to leave that
there waiting until our pastas cooked
and of course when I say cook the pasta
you know I mean one minute less than the
package directions we wanted a little
undercooked when we add it to our sauce
at this point because we want it to
finish cooking in that luscious scallop
sherry cream sauce so we're going to
transfer our pasta in we're going to
give it a little mix I'm going to turn
the heat back up to medium-high for this
last couple minutes of cooking I'm going
to switch back to the spatula so I can
get a good feel for that sauce remember
those old science fiction movies with
the aliens could see through their
fingers it's kind of like that and while
we're waiting for this mixture to come
back to a simmer I'm going to go ahead
and throw in half the parsley oh yeah
you heard me right just half we're going
to put half in at the end and then all
we're going to do here is cook that
pasta in that hot sauce for about a
minute until it finishes cooking and
absorbs some of those amazing flavors
and if at any point you need to thin
this out a little bit just drip a little
bit of pasta water in and that's a
perfect way to adjust the texture and
conversely if it's too thin crank up the
heat and reduce a little more it'll be
fine I mean don't get drunk with power
but you are in complete control of this
dish and then for the sake of argument
let's just say at this point we all
decided the pasta is perfect
the sauce is perfect to finish you're
going to turn off the heat and I'm going
to give this a generous generous grade
inna with our real imported Italian
parmesan you want to be asking for the
Reggiano and there's a reason it's crazy
expensive which is fine by the way
because you only need a little bit of
the real stuff so some parmesan and then
other than tasting and adjusting for
seasoning you're ready to serve but
don't forget we still have half the
parsley left so let's go ahead and toss
the rest in and give it one last mix
before we serve and why do we put in the
parsley two different points because
you're going to get slight variations in
flavor and I'll probably talk about that
on the blog but if I don't remind me and
as soon as that's mixed in we're going
to go ahead and serve this up did I use
warm bowls of course I'm insulted by
your question always serve pasta and hot
bowls let's just consider it so we're
going to dish that up we're going to
spoon over some of those sweet delicious
scallops and creamy sherry sauce
and as I usually do i decided to garnish
with some extra parmesan and a pinch of
parsley and a pinch of pepper flakes but
that's up to you
you are the i-ching of your garnishing
but no matter how you garnish this I
think you're going to agree it is fast
it is easy and it is incredibly
delicious that lightly garlic subtly
lemony slightly sweet sherry cream sauce
is just perfect with the natural
sweetness of the bay scallops just a
beautiful combination like I said after
all those complicated cumbersome
time-consuming holiday recipes this is
exactly what I was in the mood for
something fast something easy and like I
said several times incredibly tasty so I
really do hope you give this a try head
over to food wishes calm for all the
ingredients and more info as usual and
as always enjoy
